Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos Island, Lagos

	We are seeking a proactive and focused Customer Service Representative to join our growing team.
	This individual will serve as the first point of contact for our customers, ensuring inquiries are handled professionally, complaints are resolved promptly, and customers leave every interaction satisfied.


Key Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries via phone, email, and all provided channels promptly and professionally.
	Resolve complaints and escalate complex issues where necessary.
	Maintain accurate records of customer interactions.
	Provide product/service information and guidance to customers.
	Support sales and marketing teams with customer feedback.
	Follow up with customers to ensure their issues are fully resolved.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc Degree in any discipline.
	1 - 2 years of experience in a customer service or client-facing role.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and customer service software tools.
	Ability to work under pressure and multitask.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Training and career development opportunities.
	A supportive and collaborative work environment.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head of Public Relations",
  "description": "Pulse is Africa&rsquo;s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa&rsquo;s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Public Relations

Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role


	We are launching a new Public Relations unit and are seeking a visionary and highly motivated Head of PR to lead it. We need a leader who will not only build and manage our PR service offering but also drive its growth by actively acquiring new clients and generating revenue.
	This is a leadership rolereporting to the Director of Marketing withan entrepreneurial spirit and a deep understanding of how to translate Public relations outcomes into measurable business value, which requires demonstrating the tangible impact of public relations on business goals like revenue, leads and customer acquisition.


Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership &amp; Unit Development:


	Design, launch, and scale our new PR service offering from the ground up, defining its unique value proposition and service packages.
	Develop a strategic roadmap for the PR unit, outlining its growth trajectory, service specialisations, and hiring needs.
	Establish and maintain our agency&#39;s reputation as a leader in PR.
	Mentor and build a high-performing PR team, fostering a culture of creativity, strategic thinking, and accountability.


Revenue Generation &amp; Business Development:


	Actively prospect, pitch and close new PR clients to meet and exceed ambitious revenue targets.
	Identify opportunities for cross-selling PR services to our existing digital marketing clients.
	Develop and present compelling, data-driven proposals that showcase the value and ROI of our PR strategies.
	Build and maintain a strong professional network of media contacts, journalists, influencers and industry leaders in Nigeria and beyond.


Client Strategy &amp; Management:


	Serve as the primary strategic advisor for all PR clients, overseeing the development and execution of impactful public relations campaigns.
	Ensure all PR activities from media relations to thought leadership and influencer engagement are integrated with our clients&#39; broader marketing and business objectives.
	Manage client relationships, expectations, and feedback to ensure high satisfaction and long-term retention.
	Provide regular, insightful reports that clearly demonstrate the impact of PR on brand awareness, reputation and key business metrics.


Execution &amp; Innovation:


	Oversee the creation of all PR-related content, including press releases, media kits, pitches and executive-level communications, working closely with the creative team, strategy team and art directors.
	Working closely with the strategy team, develop and implement strategies for crisis communications, media training and reputation management.
	Stay ahead of industry trends, emerging platforms, and new technologies in the PR and media landscape, incorporating innovative tactics into our service offering.
	Leverage SEO best practices to ensure all digital PR efforts contribute to improved search visibility and organic traffic for our clients.


Shared Services Responsibilities:


	Provide support on selected projects and initiatives for Pulse Africa
	Contribute to PR strategies, media relations and campaign planning for Pulse Africa-related projects where alignment is required.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or a related field.
	Minimum of 6 years of experience in a senior public relations role, preferably within an agency environment.
	Proven track record of driving revenue and leading business development or sales initiatives.
	A strong portfolio of successful PR campaigns and a wide network of media contacts in Nigeria.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives and pitches.
	Deep understanding of the digital media landscape, including social media, SEO, influencer marketing, and content marketing.
	Demonstrated leadership ability, with experience in mentoring and managing a team.
	Strategic, entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for building something from the ground up.


Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance

Head of Public Relations Job at Pulse Nigeria




        
    

        
        Pulse is Africa’s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head of Public Relations

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

The Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are launching a new Public Relations unit and are seeking a visionary and highly motivated Head of PR to lead it. We need a leader who will not only build and manage our PR service offering but also drive its growth by actively acquiring new clients and generating revenue.
	This is a leadership rolereporting to the Director of Marketing withan entrepreneurial spirit and a deep understanding of how to translate Public relations outcomes into measurable business value, which requires demonstrating the tangible impact of public relations on business goals like revenue, leads and customer acquisition.


Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership & Unit Development:


	Design, launch, and scale our new PR service offering from the ground up, defining its unique value proposition and service packages.
	Develop a strategic roadmap for the PR unit, outlining its growth trajectory, service specialisations, and hiring needs.
	Establish and maintain our agency's reputation as a leader in PR.
	Mentor and build a high-performing PR team, fostering a culture of creativity, strategic thinking, and accountability.


Revenue Generation & Business Development:


	Actively prospect, pitch and close new PR clients to meet and exceed ambitious revenue targets.
	Identify opportunities for cross-selling PR services to our existing digital marketing clients.
	Develop and present compelling, data-driven proposals that showcase the value and ROI of our PR strategies.
	Build and maintain a strong professional network of media contacts, journalists, influencers and industry leaders in Nigeria and beyond.


Client Strategy & Management:


	Serve as the primary strategic advisor for all PR clients, overseeing the development and execution of impactful public relations campaigns.
	Ensure all PR activities from media relations to thought leadership and influencer engagement are integrated with our clients' broader marketing and business objectives.
	Manage client relationships, expectations, and feedback to ensure high satisfaction and long-term retention.
	Provide regular, insightful reports that clearly demonstrate the impact of PR on brand awareness, reputation and key business metrics.


Execution & Innovation:


	Oversee the creation of all PR-related content, including press releases, media kits, pitches and executive-level communications, working closely with the creative team, strategy team and art directors.
	Working closely with the strategy team, develop and implement strategies for crisis communications, media training and reputation management.
	Stay ahead of industry trends, emerging platforms, and new technologies in the PR and media landscape, incorporating innovative tactics into our service offering.
	Leverage SEO best practices to ensure all digital PR efforts contribute to improved search visibility and organic traffic for our clients.


Shared Services Responsibilities:


	Provide support on selected projects and initiatives for Pulse Africa
	Contribute to PR strategies, media relations and campaign planning for Pulse Africa-related projects where alignment is required.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Public Relations, Communications, Marketing, Journalism, or a related field.
	Minimum of 6 years of experience in a senior public relations role, preferably within an agency environment.
	Proven track record of driving revenue and leading business development or sales initiatives.
	A strong portfolio of successful PR campaigns and a wide network of media contacts in Nigeria.
	Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to craft compelling narratives and pitches.
	Deep understanding of the digital media landscape, including social media, SEO, influencer marketing, and content marketing.
	Demonstrated leadership ability, with experience in mentoring and managing a team.
	Strategic, entrepreneurial mindset with a passion for building something from the ground up.


Benefits


	Competitive salary based on experience
	Hybrid work options
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication allowance

  "description": "Pulse is Africa&rsquo;s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa&rsquo;s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Videographer

Job Location:&nbsp;Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are looking for Social Videographers to create high-quality, engaging short-form video content for Pulse&rsquo;s social platforms and to cover live events.
	The role requires a hands-on creator who can shoot, edit, and package videos for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook. Social Videographers will work closely with the Instagram Lead, TikTok Lead, and Creator Lead to bring ideas to life - from trending challenges and explainers to event coverage and creator collabs.
	This role is for someone who is both technically skilled and creatively attuned to youth culture, and who thrives in both fast-turnaround social media editing and on-the-ground event environments.


Key Responsibilities
Content Production:


	Shoot and edit short-form videos optimised for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook.
	Capture social-first footage in studio and field settings, adapting to both controlled shoots and spontaneous content moments.
	Package videos with captions, graphics, transitions, and music for maximum impact.
	Ensure the content is mobile-first, visually appealing, and designed to capture audiences quickly.


Event Coverage:


	Cover live events, including concerts, red carpets, celebrity appearances, brand activations, and influencer gatherings.
	Capture behind-the-scenes moments and trending content during events for real-time publishing.
	Work with editorial and social teams to ensure event coverage is optimised for social platforms.
	Edit and publish highlights quickly to maximise visibility while the event is still trending.


Creative Collaboration:


	Work with Social Content Leads to execute briefs and trending concepts.
	Collaborate with the Creator Lead on creator-led productions and event collabs.
	Partner with Graphic Designers to integrate branded templates and motion graphics.
	Contribute to team brainstorms with fresh ideas for video formats.


Trend Awareness &amp; Adaptation:


	Stay on top of TikTok/Instagram trends, audio tracks, filters, and editing styles.
	Quickly adapt trending formats into Pulse-branded content.
	Recommend new content experiments, transitions, and creative approaches.


Technical Execution:


	Operate cameras, lighting, and audio equipment for shoots and live event coverage.
	Edit content using CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or Final Cut Pro.
	Optimise aspect ratios (9:16, 1:1, 16:9) and lengths for multi-platform delivery.
	Maintain organised file management for footage and edits.


Performance &amp; Improvement:


	Review performance data with Social Leads to identify winning content styles.
	Continuously refine editing, pacing, and storytelling techniques based on audience feedback.
	Support reporting with creative takeaways for future planning.


Requirements


	2&ndash;4 years of experience creating video content for social media platforms.
	Strong portfolio of TikToks, Reels, event coverage, or short-form video content.
	Proficiency in video editing software (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, and After Effects is a plus.
	Ability to shoot with both smartphones and professional cameras.
	Knowledge of lighting, sound, and filming setups for both studio and live events.
	Strong grasp of social-first storytelling: quick hooks, engaging transitions, fast-paced edits.
	Experience in capturing and editing event-based content under tight timelines.
	Bonus: photography skills for social event coverage.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance Cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.

        Pulse is Africa’s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Videographer

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for Social Videographers to create high-quality, engaging short-form video content for Pulse’s social platforms and to cover live events.
	The role requires a hands-on creator who can shoot, edit, and package videos for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook. Social Videographers will work closely with the Instagram Lead, TikTok Lead, and Creator Lead to bring ideas to life - from trending challenges and explainers to event coverage and creator collabs.
	This role is for someone who is both technically skilled and creatively attuned to youth culture, and who thrives in both fast-turnaround social media editing and on-the-ground event environments.


Key Responsibilities
Content Production:


	Shoot and edit short-form videos optimised for TikTok, Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts, and Facebook.
	Capture social-first footage in studio and field settings, adapting to both controlled shoots and spontaneous content moments.
	Package videos with captions, graphics, transitions, and music for maximum impact.
	Ensure the content is mobile-first, visually appealing, and designed to capture audiences quickly.


Event Coverage:


	Cover live events, including concerts, red carpets, celebrity appearances, brand activations, and influencer gatherings.
	Capture behind-the-scenes moments and trending content during events for real-time publishing.
	Work with editorial and social teams to ensure event coverage is optimised for social platforms.
	Edit and publish highlights quickly to maximise visibility while the event is still trending.


Creative Collaboration:


	Work with Social Content Leads to execute briefs and trending concepts.
	Collaborate with the Creator Lead on creator-led productions and event collabs.
	Partner with Graphic Designers to integrate branded templates and motion graphics.
	Contribute to team brainstorms with fresh ideas for video formats.


Trend Awareness & Adaptation:


	Stay on top of TikTok/Instagram trends, audio tracks, filters, and editing styles.
	Quickly adapt trending formats into Pulse-branded content.
	Recommend new content experiments, transitions, and creative approaches.


Technical Execution:


	Operate cameras, lighting, and audio equipment for shoots and live event coverage.
	Edit content using CapCut, Adobe Premiere Pro, or Final Cut Pro.
	Optimise aspect ratios (9:16, 1:1, 16:9) and lengths for multi-platform delivery.
	Maintain organised file management for footage and edits.


Performance & Improvement:


	Review performance data with Social Leads to identify winning content styles.
	Continuously refine editing, pacing, and storytelling techniques based on audience feedback.
	Support reporting with creative takeaways for future planning.


Requirements


	2–4 years of experience creating video content for social media platforms.
	Strong portfolio of TikToks, Reels, event coverage, or short-form video content.
	Proficiency in video editing software (CapCut, Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, and After Effects is a plus.
	Ability to shoot with both smartphones and professional cameras.
	Knowledge of lighting, sound, and filming setups for both studio and live events.
	Strong grasp of social-first storytelling: quick hooks, engaging transitions, fast-paced edits.
	Experience in capturing and editing event-based content under tight timelines.
	Bonus: photography skills for social event coverage.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance Cover
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.
